channel.title: Arios 498 release!
channel.description:
Thanks to an ex-developer starting to sell an old copy of Arios and eventually giving it out for free in a public chat, I'm publicly releasing an old version of Arios. This version does contain some major bugs (you'll find out which soon enough), and I'm not offering any fixes for it.
If you don't know Arios, come to the surface from beneath your rock and look at these threads: [url=https://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,593939.0.html]https://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,593939.0.html[/url]
I have but 2 requests. 1) We've spent 3 years of extensive developing on this, so if you have any sense of honour; give credits to me (Emperor) and Vexia. 2) If you've bought this source, dispute your payment. I don't want a parasite to make money from our hard work.
Download link: [url=https://mega.co.nz/#!94kXkSDT!7zjQF-pzx8jsCZcVZZtAbuey0hGV7NdKrUKqAezJHiQ]https://mega.co.nz/#!94kXkSDT!7zjQF-pzx8jsCZcVZZtAbuey0hGV7NdKrUKqAezJHiQ[/url] http://www.mediafire.com/download/d62tr1q6u9v2c7w/Arios_public_release.rar

item.title: Arios 498 release!
item.dc:creator: @zacajack zacajack
item.description:
@zacajack wrote:

hey guys to fix the error with eclipse just remove 10 0 lowmem members 32 and leave it blank hope that helped

Read full topic

item.title: Arios 498 release!
item.dc:creator: @khayam khayam
item.description:
@khayam wrote:

[quote=“Kyle-Billni, post:21, topic:547098”][quote author=Bl3nd link=topic=665997.msg4462607#msg4462607 date=1418327256]

Open up Eclipse, go New>New Project (click on Use Default Location)>Browse (find your client folder)>Finish. Done.

Once you’ve done that, right click on the project>Run As>Run Configurations…>Right click on Java Application>New>Fill in the Name>In the Main class: Hit Search, then choose the Client class>Go to Arguments tab>Enter this: 10 0 lowmem members 32 (if you want highmem, then just switch lowmem to highmem)>Apply>Run. It should run with no problems…
[/quote]
I did what you said Bl3nd but I am getting this? [sub][2014-12-18 20:43:34][Arios]: Launching game client…
Exception in thread “main” java.lang.NumberFormatException: For input string: "lowmem"
at java.lang.NumberFormatException.forInputString(Unknown Source)
at java.lang.Integer.parseInt(Unknown Source)
at java.lang.Integer.parseInt(Unknown Source)
at org.arios.GameLaunch.main(GameLaunch.java:45)
[/sub] How can I fix this? I really want to see how this works.[/quote]

ive got the same problem with client too, how can i fix please?

Read full topic

item.title: Arios 498 release!
item.dc:creator: @Kyle-Billni Kyle-Billni
item.description:
@Kyle-Billni wrote:

[quote=“Bl3nd, post:24, topic:547098”][quote author=Kyle-Billni link=topic=665997.msg4463894#msg4463894 date=1418959102]

Open up Eclipse, go New>New Project (click on Use Default Location)>Browse (find your client folder)>Finish. Done.

Once you’ve done that, right click on the project>Run As>Run Configurations…>Right click on Java Application>New>Fill in the Name>In the Main class: Hit Search, then choose the Client class>Go to Arguments tab>Enter this: 10 0 lowmem members 32 (if you want highmem, then just switch lowmem to highmem)>Apply>Run. It should run with no problems…

I did what you said Bl3nd but I am getting this? [sub][2014-12-18 20:43:34][Arios]: Launching game client…
Exception in thread “main” java.lang.NumberFormatException: For input string: "lowmem"
at java.lang.NumberFormatException.forInputString(Unknown Source)
at java.lang.Integer.parseInt(Unknown Source)
at java.lang.Integer.parseInt(Unknown Source)
at org.arios.GameLaunch.main(GameLaunch.java:45)
[/sub] How can I fix this? I really want to see how this works.

So when you open up the run configurations while you have that project selected, when you go into the arguments tab (b= Arguments[/b]) did you put those into the Program arguments or VM arguments? Nevermind, I saw you Sever Help topic.

However,
have you tried highmem to see if that works?

Nope but will try that thanks.

Edit: Nope same error
[sub][2014-12-18 22:19:38][Arios]: Launching game client…
Exception in thread “main” java.lang.NumberFormatException: For input string: "highmem"
at java.lang.NumberFormatException.forInputString(Unknown Source)
at java.lang.Integer.parseInt(Unknown Source)
at java.lang.Integer.parseInt(Unknown Source)
at org.arios.GameLaunch.main(GameLaunch.java:45)[/sub]
[/quote]

Hmm…it worked for me? That’s exactly how I set up mine…[/quote]
Hmm, would you help me over TV or add me on skype? If not its fine I just wanted to see what this was like (:

Read full topic

item.title: Arios 498 release!
item.dc:creator: @Bl3nd Bl3nd
item.description:
@Bl3nd wrote:

williams15:

anyone got a working client for this??? not sure how to use eclipse :S

Open up Eclipse, go New>New Project (click on Use Default Location)>Browse (find your client folder)>Finish. Done.

Once you’ve done that, right click on the project>Run As>Run Configurations…>Right click on Java Application>New>Fill in the Name>In the Main class: Hit Search, then choose the Client class>Go to Arguments tab>Enter this: 10 0 lowmem members 32 (if you want highmem, then just switch lowmem to highmem)>Apply>Run. It should run with no problems…

Read full topic

item.title: Arios 498 release!
item.dc:creator: @Suffixion Suffixion
item.description:
@Suffixion wrote:

Onyx12:

There’s a client folder in here, but no way to run the client how do I get a client to start running this. I’ve been working on this all day, it’s starting to get frustrating. If anyone could help I’d appreciate it a lot.

Hey, don’t know if you still need/want help with this but there’s a file called GameLaunch.java. (Client/src/org/arios/GameLaunch.java) Just execute that, and the client will load.

Read full topic
